name: Tahini Sesame Noodles
description: This quick and filling noodle dish makes a for a great side, or simply serve it with some extra veggies and lean protein for a craveable meal you’ll want to make again and again! Soba noodles are made from buckwheat flour, a gluten-free grain with a high protein content for healthy muscles. Buckwheat is also high in manganese for healthy bones, and B vitamins for energy and metabolism. Make it a complete meal—top your bowl with Rotisserie Chicken!

ingredients.name: Sesame Ginger Dressing Mix, Maple Miso Marinade Mix or Sesame Noodle Salad Dressing Mix

preparation: Cook noodles in Multipurpose Pot according to package directions. Add kale to pot for final 1–2 min of cooking. Drain.
Meanwhile, in medium bowl, whisk mix with tahini, sesame oil, water, and soy sauce. Thinly slice radishes and slice lime into wedges.
Toss noodles with prepared dressing. Divide between 4 bowls and top with sliced radish, lime wedges.
tips: Cook any green vegetables with the noodles at the same time as the kale—think broccoli, cabbage, or bok choy!
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 4 oz (113 g) lean protein and 1 cup steamed veggies.

products.name: Sesame Ginger Dressing Mix
summary: Taste of Asia with ginger, garlic, sesame seeds & herbs.

products.name: Sesame Noodle Salad Dressing Mix
summary: This dressing is everything! It’s creamy, nutty, garlicky, and umami—and it’s dairy-free, nut-free, soy-free, and egg-free! Blend it with pantry staples and drizzle the flavour of turmeric, ginger, and garlic on everything from noodle salads and poke bowls to veggies, stir-fries, and more!
